text.p: The following are the reports carried by Estonia's newspapers on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy:
- Parliament is debating a law on special pensions and other social guarantees for high government officials and deputies.
- The Coalition Party, the leading ruling party, recommended Ivi Eenmaa, director of the national library, as candidate for mayor of Tallinn and she has accepted the proposal.
- Priit Saksing, former director of the Silmet metal processing plant, accused the Coalition Party of persecuting him in connection with an accusation of embezzlement.
- The European Union commission is dissatisfied with the internal security in Estonia and would place Estonia in a third group of candidates for admission to the EU, diplomats warn.
- Police director Ain Seppik called for reinforced security measures for government officials.
- New Interior Minister Robert Lepikson is expected to make major changes in the ministry and the police department.
- Former tax department director Ardo Ojasalu is currently offering companies tax factoring services.
- The management of the Hotel Viru is ready to finance a 15-storey expansion worth 150 million kroons. Building may begin next year.
- Uhispank and an investment firm have founded a company for business in the Russian securities market.
